abstract.p: Howard Levine letter on Sara Davidson's article on Ram Dass's stroke and other articles holds May 21 magazine distilled best and worst of life into about 100 pages

block.p: I was half-full of bourbon and pork chops as I read Sara Davidson's kind article (May 21) on Ram Dass's stroke, followed by Ian Fisher's sobering text and Ettore Malanca's photographs of the Burundian camps. As an avid bird-watcher and gardener, I enjoyed Jonathan Rosen's reflections. Robert Mackey's Lives column on sexual decoys restored my commitment to weekends in the mountains forgetting.
I felt compelled to thank you for poignantly distilling the best and worst of life into about 100 pages.
